alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 4:38PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A line of showers with strong winds will impact portions of western Sussex, Warren, Monroe and northeastern Northampton Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 436 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers extending from Skytop to near Tannersville to near Belfast. Movement was east at 35 mph. The Pocono Mountains Municipal Airport recently measured a 48 mph wind gust with this line of showers. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Montague, Mount Pocono, East Stroudsburg, Tobyhanna, Blairstown, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Belvidere, Oxford, Hope, Belfast, East Bangor, Branchville, Stormville, Werry Lake, Pocono Pines, Greendell and Millbrook. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 291 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 19. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
